The 'Canidae' Canidae. Dictionary.com. The American Heritage Stedman's
Medical Dictionary. Houghton Mifflin Company.
http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Canidae (accessed: February 16,
2009). are the biological family of carnivorous and omnivorous mammals
that includes domestic dogs, wolves, foxes, jackals, coyotes, and many other
lesser known extant and extinct dog-like mammals. A member of this family is
called a 'canid' (). The Canidae family is divided into two tribes: Canini
(related to wolves) and Vulpini (related to foxes). The two species of the basal
Caninae are more primitive and do not fit into either tribe.
